customer_addr:
272 Pickle Hill Rd
Fort Plain, NY 13339

citations.narrative:
Several adult French Bulldogs and their puppies, as well as several enclosures of weaned puppies did not have proper
methods of identification. Cage cards are utilized for inventory/birth records and ID purposes, and the name of the adult
female dogs and the date of birth of the puppies was recorded, however most of the required information was not
included. When cage cards are used for identification they must contain the required information such as dams ID, the
USDA certificate number, a unique number identifying each puppy, a description of each puppy including sex and color,
and the date of disposition. The licensee must document and display this identification information as required by this
section of the AWA.
*******Correct by 3/1/25

At the time of inspection, documentation was reviewed for two recently acquired German Shepherd dogs, however the
Record of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS Form 7005) had not been updated. In addition, several adult
French bulldogs had not been added to the APHIS 7005 Form. Record must be updated to show all dog acquisitions and
must be kept current to accurately reflect the inventory in the kennel. The licensee must correct this issue and update the
APHIS 7005 document.
*****Correct by 3/1/25
This inspection was a site approval inspection.
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.50(b) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
Several adult French Bulldogs and their puppies, as well as several enclosures of weaned puppies did not have proper 
methods of identification. Cage cards are utilized for inventory/birth records and ID purposes, and the name of the adult 
female dogs and the date of birth of the puppies was recorded, however most of the required information was not 
included. When cage cards are used for identification they must contain the required information such as dams ID, the 
USDA certificate number, a unique number identifying each puppy, a description of each puppy including sex and color, 
and the date of disposition. The licensee must document and display this identification information as required by this 
section of the AWA. 
 
*******Correct by 3/1/25 
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
At the time of inspection, documentation was reviewed for two recently acquired German Shepherd dogs, however the 
Record of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS Form 7005) had not been updated. In addition, several adult 
French bulldogs had not been added to the APHIS 7005 Form. Record must be updated to show all dog acquisitions and 
must be kept current to accurately reflect the inventory in the kennel. The licensee must correct this issue and update the 
APHIS 7005 document.  
 
*****Correct by 3/1/25 
 
This inspection was a site approval inspection. 
 
 
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License. 
 
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.

Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
